title: Potential energy of system as function of t

content.question: A small mass is released from rest at a very great distance from a larger stationary mass. Which of the following graphs best represents the gravitational potential energy U of the system of the two masses as a function of t ?

choices.label: A graph plots U versus t. An increasing line starting from the origin and rising diagonally is plotted in the first quadrant.
A graph plots U versus t. A decreasing line is plotted in the fourth quadrant, falling diagonally from the origin.
A graph plots U versus t. A concave upward increasing curve is plotted in the first quadrant, rising from the origin.
A graph plots U versus t. A concave downward decreasing curve is plotted in the fourth quadrant, falling from the origin.

A graph plots U versus t. A concave upward downward increasing curve is plotted in the fourth quadrant. The curve rises along the negative vertical axis, bends rightward, then extends below and toward the positive x-axis.

content.answer: A graph plots U versus t. A concave downward decreasing curve is plotted in the fourth quadrant, falling from the origin.
